name: X-Mem
tagline: A Cross-Platform and Extensible Memory Characterization Tool for the Cloud
body:
X-Mem is a flexible open-source research tool for characterizing memory hierarchy throughput, latency, power, and more. The tool was developed jointly by [Microsoft](http://www.microsoft.com) and the [UCLA NanoCAD Lab](http://nanocad.ee.ucla.edu). The project was started by [Mark Gottscho](http://seas.ucla.edu/~gottscho) (Email: mgottscho@ucla.edu) as a Summer 2014 PhD intern at [Microsoft Research](http://research.microsoft.com). X-Mem is released freely and open-source under the MIT License. The project is under active development. Stay tuned for more updates.

# Repositories
Microsoft hosts the main repository on GitHub at https://github.com/Microsoft/X-Mem.git. A mirror is maintained by the UCLA NanoCAD Lab on GitHub at https://github.com/nanocad-lab/X-Mem.git. NanoCAD also hosts this project page.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
